title: Shift Force Sensor Adaption

body.body: The shift force sensor adaption is required to allow for manufacturing tolerances of the shift force sensor. The motorcycle is delivered from the factory with the shift force sensor fully adapted.
The shift force sensor adaption must be reset and re-adapted under the following conditions:
If a shift force sensor malfunction occurs (DTC P1702 and P1703, see
If the shift force sensor has been removed or disconnected for any reason.
To reset the shift force sensor adaption:
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition ON.
Check and erase any stored DTCs.
Select ADJUST TUNE then select Shift Force Sensor Adaption Reset.
The software will confirm that the adaption has been successfully reset.
Warning - General - Confined Area Engine Running
Exhaust fumes are poisonous, always operate a motorcycle in the open-air or in an area with adequate ventilation.
Do not operate a motorcycle in an enclosed area without adequate ventilation.
Operating a motorcycle in an enclosed area without adequate ventilation can cause loss of consciousness and death within a short period of time.
If necessary, the neutral position can be re-adapted simultaneously with the shift force sensor re-adaption (see
To re-adapt the shift force sensor:
Ensure the transmission is in neutral.
For successful and accurate adaption, The engine must be at normal idle speed and the gear change pedal must be in its normal rested position.
During adaption, do not raise the engine speed and do not touch or move the gear change pedal.
The shift force sensor will adapt shortly after engine start provided the above conditions are met.
The adaption status can be confirmed by selecting TRIUMPH SHIFT ASSIST ADAPTION STATUS on the Triumph diagnostic tool.
